noun.description: A form of amateur dramatic entertainment, popular among the nobility in 16th- and 17th-century England, which consisted of dancing and acting performed by masked players.

examples: adding a treatment masque to your cleansing routine works wonders

origin: Early 16th century (in the sense masquerade or masked ball): probably a back-formation (influenced by French masque mask) from masker, from Italian mascar person wearing a mask.
